newsapp.management.commands package¶

Submodules¶

newsapp.management.commands.setup_roles module¶

class newsapp.management.commands.setup_roles.Command(stdout=None, stderr=None, no_color=False, force_color=False)¶

Bases: BaseCommand

Provides a custom management command to set up user groups and permissions.

This class defines a Django management command that creates predefined user groups and assigns specific permissions to each group. It is designed to manage roles for users interacting with the Article model. The groups created are Reader, Editor, and Journalist, and each group is granted distinct permissions for the Article model.

Usage: The command should be executed via Django’s manage.py command-line utility.

Variables:

help – Message displayed with the help command that describes thepurpose of this management command.

handle(*args, **kwargs)¶

The actual logic of the command. Subclasses must implement this method.

help = 'Set up user groups and permissions'¶
